definition: to treat utterly sincerely/open and above board in dealing with sb

sentences.english: I give to filled with the absolute sincerity you, is willing you to be forever strong, is forever vigorous.
sentences.chinese: 我把滿腔赤誠獻給你，願你永遠堅強，永遠蓬勃。

sentences.english: Jinjiufu keeps its promise of faith and is as sincere as gold to its partners.
sentences.chinese: 金九福對信譽一諾千金，對客戶及合作伙伴赤誠如金。

sentences.english: I am dying to pull out my heart so that you can feel my absolute sincerity.
sentences.chinese: 恨不能把心掏出給你看，讓你明白我的赤誠。

sentences.english: It directed my loyalties to the side of men in rebellion .
sentences.chinese: 它把我的赤誠之心引導到反抗着的人們這方面來了。

sentences.english: I want you so, true like ice, true like fire.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你也一樣，赤誠似火，堅貞如冰。

sentences.english: To pledge myself uphold and practice the ideals of Zonta.
sentences.chinese: 以一己赤誠，維護和實行崇她理想。

sentences.english: To children and the educational cause you ve contributed your sincere heart.
sentences.chinese: 爲孩子，爲事業，您獻出一片赤誠的心。

sentences.english: Ethics, is the love of the child 's heart.
sentences.chinese: 師德，是熱愛孩子的赤誠之心。

definition: to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
